results.title: ACE inhibition reduces infarction in normotensive but not hypertensive rats: correlation with cortical ACE activity.
results.text_hl: Normotensive (Wistar-Kyoto (WKY)) and @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ (spontaneously @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ (SHR)) animals were treated with the @GENE_AP2B1 @GENE_163 @@@ACE@@@ inhibitors @CHEMICAL_Ramipril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017257 @@@ramipril@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ for 7 or 42 days before 2 hours of transient @<m>DISEASE_Infarction_Middle_Cerebral_Artery</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020244 @@@middle cerebral artery occlusion@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Infarction_Middle_Cerebral_Artery</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020244 @@@MCAo@@@).

citations.NLM: Porritt MJ, Chen M, Rewell SS, Dean RG, Burrell LM, Howells DW. ACE inhibition reduces infarction in normotensive but not hypertensive rats: correlation with cortical ACE activity. J Cereb Blood Flow Metab. 2010 Aug;30(8):1520-6. PMID: 20407464
